reviews.review_msg: Jillian was a great professor. Her lectures were very clear and straight-forward, her tests were fair, and she was always available for help.

I took SA 150 with Jillian Deri, and it was hands down the best class iv taken at sfu! She is very passionate about course and keeps the lectures interesting. The papers very long but over exams arent  hard if you study. Although the profs amazing.. it still all depends on the TA.

My TA was a tough marker, and I hate sociology in general so I hate the class, but Jillian is really an excellent prof. She's passionate, cares about students, crystal clear in lectures and does not hesitate to help you if you need it. She's anything but boring. Tests are based off definitions of terms in book, memorize them and you'll be good.

I should've rated this prof and class sooner... it was quite enjoyable. I believe it was worth 4 credits too. Jillian showed a video of a friend of hers who had transitioned from male to female, and it was very inspirational. She wasn't afraid of difficult questions or naivety. I have a lot of respect for that. She was sweet, though often awkward.

Jillian is passionate about Sociology and provides various video clips that leave you thinking. The course content is extremely easy because this stuff surrounds us in our social environments. Her lectures are straight word-for-word from the textbook. Contribute and pay attention in class and you are good to go! Definitely an easy course!
